trans-unit.source: Provides a collection of values that describe a profile property.
You use the ProfilePropertyMetadata class to retrieve information about a profile property when you access profiles through the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService> class.
You can retrieve the name and type of the property, whether it is read-only, whether it can be accessed by users who have not been authenticated, and the default value.
An application can take the appropriate actions based on these values, such as not trying to set a read-only property.

To access the ProfilePropertyMetadata object from an application that is compatible with the Windows Communication Framework (WCF), use the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService.GetPropertiesMetadata%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService> class.
The user does not have to be logged on to retrieve the ProfilePropertyMetadata object because the metadata for profile properties is not specific to a user's profile property values.
The values in the ProfilePropertyMetadata class are set in the Web.config file in the element of the section when the property is defined.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfilePropertyMetadata"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the property is available to unauthenticated users.
When you enable anonymous identification with settings in the element, you can set which profile properties are available to anonymous users.
You set the AllowAnonymousAccess property in the element of the section of the Web.config file when the property is defined.
From the client application, use the AllowAnonymousAccess property to determine whether a profile property can be set for an anonymous user.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the property is available to unauthenticated users; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the default value of the property.

The serialized format of the DefaultValue property is determined by the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfilePropertyMetadata.SerializeAs%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfilePropertyMetadata> class.
A serialized representation of the default value for the property, if a default value is defined in the Web.config file; otherwise the string "(null)".
Gets or sets a reference to an <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ExtensionDataObject"></xref> instance.
A reference to an object that stores extended data during deserialization operations.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a profile property is read-only.
You set the IsReadOnly property in the element of the section of the Web.config file when the property is defined.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the profile property is read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of the profile property.
You set the PropertyName property in the element of the section of the Web.config file when the property is defined.
The name of the profile property as defined in the Web.config file.
Gets or sets a value that indicates how to serialize the property value.
You set the SerializeAs property in the element of the section of the Web.config file when the property is defined.
The enumeration value.
Gets or sets the assembly-qualified name of the profile property type.
You set the TypeName property in the element of the section of the Web.config file when the property is defined.
The assembly-qualified name of the profile property type.
